meanings.sent1: The shrill whistle of the tea kettle hurt my ears.
meanings.sent2: The shrill cry of the baby could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent3: The shrill alarm clock woke me up with a jolt.
meanings.sent4: The shrill wind howled through the night, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The shrill scream of the hawk echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched and piercing sound.
meanings.sent1: She shrilled in excitement when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The kettle shrilled as it reached boiling point.
meanings.sent3: The cat shrilled in protest when it was put in the bath.
meanings.sent4: The whistle shrilled loudly, signaling the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The bird shrilled its song, filling the forest with its melody.

meanings.definition: A high-pitched and piercing voice or sound.
meanings.sent1: Her shrill laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent2: The shrill of the siren alerted everyone to the danger.
meanings.sent3: The shrill of the microphone feedback startled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The shrill of the violin cut through the silence of the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The shrill of the whistle marked the end of the game.
